title: What's News: World-Wide
text:
Twenty internet providers, including AT&T, Comcast and Verizon, agreed to improve subsidized high-speed internet plans they offer to millions of unconnected households under a program in the infrastructure law passed last year.

New York's attorney general and state lawmakers called for the creation of a fund to pay for abortion access for New Yorkers and out-of-state residents who could travel to the state for the procedure.

A former Alabama corrections officer died apparently from a self-inflicted gunshot wound after she and an escaped inmate were captured, ending a 10-day search for the fugitive pair.

Sri Lankan Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa resigned after months of mass protests against his government's handling of an economic crisis.

What's News: World-Wide
